name: loot
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(usually of large numbers of people during a violent event) to steal from shops and houses: During the riot shops were looted and cars damaged or set on fire.

Indian English to steal something from a place or person: Burglars looted cash and mobiles from a shop in Tagore Town. The passengers in the general compartment of Shramjivi Express were looted and robbed of their valuables.

Related word
looter
money and valuable objects that have been stolen, especially by an army from a defeated enemy or by thieves: The thief must have been very disappointed when he examined his loot. He was captured and his loot was returned to the store.
in computer games, the things you get as rewards, for example for defeating an enemy, that you can use in the games: It provides the same experiences as larger dungeon games: fighting monsters, disarming traps, advancing characters, and collecting loot. Enjoy this free online adventure game - battle demons with your friends, earn loot and build the ultimate castle!

(said esp. of large numbers of people) to steal from stores: [ I ] Riot police were sent to prevent the mob from looting.
To loot something is also to take a lot of money away from it that does not belong to you: [ T ] The officers of the corporation looted the company of millions of dollars.
money or valuable objects that have been stolen: Three men have been sentenced to prison for taking part in the robbery, but the loot was never recovered.
